qas.question: What was a synonym for seppuku?
What was the reason for seppuku?

answers.text: allowed a disgraced samurai to regain his honor by passing into death
as practical on the battlefield as were any other warrior

context: Most samurai were bound by a code of honor and were expected to set an example for those below them. A notable part of their code is seppuku (切腹, seppuku?) or <a0_0>hara kiri<a0_0/>, which <a1_0>allowed a disgraced samurai to regain his honor by passing into death<a1_0/>, where samurai were still beholden to social rules. Whilst there are many <a3_0>romanticized<a3_0/> characterizations of samurai behavior such as the writing of Bushido (武士道, Bushidō?) in 1905, studies of Kobudo and traditional Budō indicate that the samurai were <a2_0>as practical on the battlefield as were any other warrior<a2_0/>.
